sobremi.hero_desc: How a Colombian public accountant found his peace in a miniature tree.
sobremi.historia_p1: My encounter with bonsai was almost casual, but it ended up marking a deep path in my life. During a professional visit to a client â€” owner of a well-known hair salon â€” my attention was drawn to a corner of his business: there rested small trees that, despite their size, conveyed the majesty of great forests. It was like contemplating giants in miniature, ancient and solemn.
sobremi.historia_p2: That first impression wrapped me in a unique feeling, as if nature had compressed itself into delicate and perfect forms. My client, a passionate bonsai grower, shared his enthusiasm with me and conveyed the idea that each tree is a work of patience and art. Since then, he became my guide in this fascinating world, teaching me techniques, care and above all, the philosophy behind each bonsai.
sobremi.historia_p3: That is how my journey began: from initial curiosity to constant dedication, finding in bonsai not just a hobby, but a space of calm and connection with nature.
sobremi.filosofia_p1: Caring for a bonsai is more than a gardening technique: it is an exercise in life. Every pruning, every watering and every wait remind me that discipline and perseverance are the foundation of all growth. Bonsai teaches me patience and self-control, because results do not come immediately, but with constant dedication.
sobremi.filosofia_p2: In each tree I find inspiration and passion, since its beauty reflects the care and love given to it day by day. For me, bonsai is a mirror of determination: an art that demands persistence, but rewards with harmony and balance. It is my way of connecting with nature and, at the same time, cultivating values that accompany me in every aspect of my life.
sobremi.cta_p: Do you share this passion? I would love to read your experience.

galeria.hero_desc: Bonsai is a millenary art that connects human beings with nature.
galeria.intro: The basic principle of bonsai is based on creating harmony between human beings and nature, cultivating miniature trees that reflect the beauty and proportions of the natural world. Each tree becomes a teacher, teaching us about life's cycles.
galeria.chokkan_desc: Chokkan is the most elegant and structured style. The trunk grows perfectly straight upward, with symmetrically distributed branches creating a perfect triangular silhouette.
galeria.shakkan_desc: The trunk tilts between 15 and 45 degrees, simulating trees that grow on slopes or shaped by the wind. The first branch grows in the opposite direction to create visual balance.
galeria.kengai_desc: One of the most dramatic styles: the trunk and main branches fall below the pot's edge, imitating trees growing on cliffs. Requires taller pots.
galeria.quote: "Every tree we cultivate becomes our teacher, teaching us about life's cycles and the importance of careful observation."

guias.hero_desc: Basic techniques, essential tools and species care.
guias.riego_desc: Bonsai needs constant but controlled watering. The key is to keep the soil moist without waterlogging. Check moisture with your finger: if the top layer is dry, it's time to water.
guias.riego_t1: Water during the cool hours of the day
guias.riego_t3: Make sure the water drains completely
guias.poda_desc: Pruning maintains the shape and health of the tree. There are two main types you should master:
guias.poda_t1: cutting new shoots to preserve the silhouette.
guias.poda_t2: removing larger branches to define the style.
guias.alambrado_desc: Used to guide branch growth and shape the tree. It is one of the most artistic techniques in bonsai.
guias.alambrado_t1: Wire must be placed carefully, avoiding damage to the bark
guias.alambrado_t2: Use aluminum wire for deciduous trees
guias.alambrado_t3: Remove it after a few months, when the branch holds its shape
guias.trasplante_desc: Repotting is fundamental for the long-term health of bonsai. It allows renewing the substrate and controlling root growth.
guias.trasplante_t1: Done every 2â€“3 years depending on the species
guias.trasplante_t2: Prune roots to maintain canopy-base balance
guias.trasplante_t3: Do it in spring, before leaves bud
guias.h3: Tweezers for removing leaves or buds
guias.ficus_desc: Resistant and adaptable. Requires good indirect light and moderate watering. Tolerates indoor environments with good lighting.
guias.pino_desc: Needs direct sunlight and controlled watering. Pruning must be careful to maintain its characteristic style and compact foliage.
guias.olmo_desc: Very adaptable and resistant. Grows fast and responds very well to frequent pruning. Excellent for practicing shaping techniques.
guias.arce_desc: Needs partial shade and protection from strong wind. Its seasonal foliage offers an unrivalled visual spectacle in autumn.

blog.hero_desc: Lessons, challenges and the philosophy of the slowly growing tree.
blog.post1_title: Patience as the root of bonsai
blog.post1_p1: Every tree teaches that results come with time and consistency. Today, after months of caring for my ficus, I saw for the first time that the branches were taking the shape I had imagined. It did not happen overnight. It happened because every day, without exception, I was present.
blog.post1_p2: Bonsai does not forgive impatience: a branch wired too long leaves scars; a forgotten watering makes the soil dry to the bottom. But it does not reward haste either. It is in that balance â€” between doing and waiting â€” where all its philosophy resides.
blog.post2_title: My first repotting: mistakes and lessons
blog.post2_p: Repotting a bonsai for the first time is like operating with nerves. The roots look so fragile that the fear of damaging them paralyzes. But the theory says it must be done, and practice confirms that the tree appreciates the new space...
blog.post3_p: A 30-centimeter bonsai can convey the solemnity of a centuries-old oak. That contradiction fascinates me: in the small, the great can live. It is perhaps the deepest lesson this art has given me so far...
blog.post4_p: As an accountant, my mind lives between numbers and deadlines. Bonsai forces me out of that logic. It reminds me that not everything has a due date, that some processes simply have their own rhythm and that respecting that rhythm is also a form of wisdom...
blog.post5_title: How it all started: the hair salon and the bonsai
blog.post5_p: No one expects to find inspiration in a hair salon. I did. It was in a quiet corner of a client's business where, for the first time, I saw a tree that was not a tree but was. That paradox captured me...
blog.quote: "Bonsai is a mirror of determination: an art that demands persistence, but rewards with harmony and balance."

recursos.hero_desc: Recommended books, videos and communities to deepen your knowledge of bonsai.
recursos.libro1_desc: A comprehensive and accessible guide for beginners and intermediate practitioners. Covers styles, techniques and species with detailed photographs.
recursos.libro2_desc: Classic work by an American-Japanese master. Deep in philosophy and technique. Indispensable reference for any serious practitioner.
recursos.libro3_desc: Excellent resource with step-by-step instructions, seasonal care and species guide adapted to Latin American climate.
recursos.video1_desc: One of the best audiovisual resources available. Advanced technique explained with clarity and depth by a master certified in Japan.
recursos.video2_desc: Channel with decades of content: from beginners to advanced techniques. Very useful for learning with subtitles.
recursos.video3_desc: Channel focused on tropical and subtropical species, very useful for the Colombian and Latin American context.
recursos.com1_desc: Active global community with more than 500,000 members. Ideal for sharing progress, asking questions and getting feedback from practitioners worldwide.
recursos.com2_desc: Local community with workshops, exhibitions and in-person meetings. Excellent for connecting with other enthusiasts in Colombia.
recursos.com3_desc: Web portal with articles, guides and forums in multiple languages. Large database of species and techniques.
